sourceMeaningMnemonic: With your <radical>fingers</radical> under an <radical>axe</radical>, you <radical>say</radical> a <kanji>vow</kanji>. A vow is a sacred promise, so you have to be really serious when you say one. That's why you do it with an axe hovering above your fingers—it's a reminder that if you break this vow your fingers are gonna get chopped off.
meaningInfo: Picture the axe hovering above your fingers. Now say the vow. But don't lie. The axe knows when you're lying.
readingMnemonic: When you finish your <kanji>vow</kanji>, you take out your holy blue <reading>sa</reading>ber (<ja>せい</ja>) and cut the axe in half! You know you're never going to break your vow, and if you do, you'll use your own saber to cut off your fingers.
readingInfo: Imagine what it would be like to slice off your own fingers with the saber you've carried for so long. You better not break that vow.
